parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
A shaking (as an earthquake); a storm. From seio; a commotion, i.e. a gale, an earthquake.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To go down, come down, either from the sky or from higher land, descend. From kata and the base of basis; to descend.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To roll away. From apo and kulioo; to roll away.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
From epi and ano; up above, i.e. Over or on.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
